title: Apple Club 2.0 - Classic Mac 1997
description:
About the Apple Club CD

Version 2.0, April 1997

Welcome to the Apple Club CD. This CD has been designed to provide you with an efficient tool for updating, maintaining, and getting the most from your Mac.

This CD has a universal System Software 7.6.1-based System Folder that will startup most Macintosh systems (Macintosh IIci or newer) with an internal or external Apple CD-ROM drive. This System Folder has been especially prepared to work on this CD only; please do not copy it to your hard drive for use on your Macintosh.

Hot Updates

New Apple software releases from specific Apple development groups, such as the latest OpenDoc and Cyberdog software for you to try out.
Selections from the Apple Software Updates that are designed to be installed directly from this CD.

Disk Utilities

This folder contains the most common utilities you may need to update or repair drives and check for viruses when booted from this CD:
Disk First Aid 7.2.2, for verifying the directory structure of your hard disk.
Drive Setup 1.2, Apple HD SC Setup 7.3.5, and Internal HD Format 1.3, for reinitializing, partitioning, and updating Apple and some third-party hard disks.
Which Do I Use, a guide to which formatting software can be used with your particular Macintosh.
Disinfectant, for detection and removal of some Macintosh viruses.
5xxx/6xxx Tester 1.0, for identifying known issues with some Power Macintosh/Performa 5xxx/6xxx series computers.
Disk Copy, for creating floppy disks from the disk images on this CD.

Apple Software Updates with DiskScript Installs

This folder contains all US Apple Software Updates released up to April 16, 1996. All of the files are in NDIF format, which requires Disk Copy 6.1 or later. Using Disk Copy DiskScripts included with each installation, you install software directly from this CD or make floppy disks.


The Information Alley Daily eMail

This folder contains all issues of Apple customer support electronic newsmagazine, up to April 15, 1997. It focuses on supporting and using Apple products, as compiled by members of the Apple Assistance Center. 

From the Tech Info Library

This folder contains files and instructions from the Apple Tech Info Library (TIL), Apple's official technical support database.

Top Tech Info Library Articles: The top 20 requested Apple Tech Info Library articles.

Frequently Asked Questions: A collection of answers to the most frequently asked questions compiled by members of the Apple Assistance Center
